{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1984 |Team=Wyoming Cowboys |Image= |ImageSize = |Conference=Western Athletic Conference |Division= |ShortConference=WAC |Record=6-6 |ConfRecord=4-4 |CoachRank= |APRank= |HeadCoach=[[Al Kincaid]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |Stadium=[[War Memorial Stadium (Wyoming)|War Memorial Stadium]] |Champion= |BowlTourney= |BowlTourneyResult= }} The '''1984 Wyoming Cowboys football team''' represented the [[University of Wyoming]] in the 1984 NCAA football season. The Cowboys offense scored 201 points while the defense allowed 182 points. Led by head coach [[Al Kincaid]], the Cowboys finished the season with six wins. [[Jay Novacek]] was in his senior season with the Cowboys. Novacek finished his Cowboys career with 83 career receptions for 1,536 yards and 10 touchdowns as a tight end.
